gurmukhi: ibn c`C BUp doaU qwq mwq ] iqn dyh pwn quh khO bwq ]
transliteration: Bin Chachchh Bhoop Dooo Taat Maat||tin Deh Paan Tuh Kahau Baat||
translation: “O king ! both my parents are without sight, listen to me and give them water.

gurmukhi: mm kQw n iqn khIXo pRbIn ] suin mrXo puqR qyaU hoih CIn ]23]
transliteration: Mam Kathaa Na Tin Kahiyo Prabeen|| Soun(i) Daryo Poutra Teoo Hoh(i) Chheen||23||
translation: “Do not say anything me to them, otherwise they will die in extreme agony.”23.

gurmukhi: ieh BwNq jbY idj khY bYn ] jl sunq BUp cuAY cly nYn ]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Jabai Dij Kahai Bain|| Jal Sounat Bhoop Chuai Chale Nain||
translation: When Shravan Kumar said these words to the king about giving (to his blind parents) then tears gushed out of his eyes.

gurmukhi: DiRg moh ijn su kIno kukrm ] hiq BXo rwj Aru gXo Drm ]24]
transliteration: Dhrig Moh Jin Su Keeno Koukaram|| Hat(i) Bhayo Raaj Ar(u) Gado Dharam||24||
translation: The king said, “It is a disgrace for me that I have done such a deed, my royal merit has been destroyed and I am devoid of Dharma.”24.

gurmukhi: jb lXo BUp iqh sr inkwr ] qb qjy pRwx mun br audwr ]
transliteration: Jab Layo Bhoop Tih Sar Nikaar|| Tab Taje Praan Mounndbar Udaar||
translation: When the king pulled out Shravan from the pool, then that ascetic breathed his last.

gurmukhi: pun BXo rwv mn mY audws ] giH plt jwn kI qjI Aws ]25]
transliteration: Poun Bhayo Raav Man Mai Udaas|| Grih Palat Jaan Kitajiaas||25||
translation: Then the king became very sad and abandoned the idea of returning to his home.25.

gurmukhi: jIA TtI ik Dwro jog Bos ] khUM bsO jwie bin iqAwig dys ]
transliteration: Jeea Thatiki Dhdaro Jog Bhes|| Kahoon Basau Jaae Ban(i) Ban(i) Tiaag(i) Des||
translation: He thought in his mind that he may wear the garb of Yogi and abide in the forest forsaking his royal duties.

gurmukhi: ikh kwj mor Xh rwj swj ] idj mwir kIXo ijn As kukwj ]26]
transliteration: Kih Kaaj Mor Yah Raaj Saaj|| Dij Daar(i) Keeyo Jin As Koukaaj||26||
translation: My roayal duties are now meaningless for me, when I have committed a bad deed by killing a Brahmin.26.

gurmukhi: ieh BwNq khI puin niRp pRbIn ] sB jgiq kwl krmY ADIn ]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Kahipoun(i) Nrip Prabeen|| Sabh Jagad(i) Kaal Karmai Adheen||
translation: The king then uttered these words, ‘I have brought under my control the situations of all the world, but now what hath been committed by me?

gurmukhi: Ab kro kCU AYso aupwie ] jw qy su bcY iqh qwq mwie ]27]
transliteration: Ab Daro Kachhodh Aiso Oupaae|| Jaa Te Su Bachai Tih Taat Maae||27||
translation: ‘Now I should take such measures, that may cause his parents to survive.’27.

gurmukhi: Bir lXo kuMB isr pY auTwie ] q`h gXo jhwN idj qwq mwie ]
transliteration: Bhar(i) Layo Kounbh Sir Pai Outhaae|| Tah Gado Jahaan Dij Taat Maae||
translation: The king filled the pitcher with water and lifted it on his head and reached at the spot, where the parents of Shravan had been lying.

gurmukhi: jb gXo inkt iqn ky su Dwr ] qb lKI duhUM iqh pwv cwr ]28]
transliteration: Jab Gado Nikat Tin Ke Su Dhaar|| Tab Lakhiduhoon Tih Paav Chaar||28||
translation: When the king reached near them with very slow steps, then they heard the voice of the moving footsteps.28.
The speech of the Brahmin addressed to the King :

gurmukhi: k`h kho puqR lwgI Avwr ] suin rihE mon BUpq audwr ]
transliteration: Kahh Kaho Poutra Laagiavaar|| Soun(i) Rahio Mon Bhoopat Udaar||
translation: “O Son ! Tell us the reason for so much delay. “Hearing these words the large-hearted king remained silent.
